text.section: A license expires at the end of every other June 30 unless it is renewed for a 2-year term as provided in this section.

At least 1 month before a license expires, the Commissioner shall mail to the holder of the license, at the last known address of the holder:
a renewal application form; and
a notice that states:
the date by which the Commissioner must receive the renewal application for the renewal to be issued and mailed before the license expires; and
the amount of the renewal fee.

Before a license expires, the holder of the license may renew it for an additional 2-year term, if the holder:
otherwise is entitled to a license;
files with the Commissioner a renewal application on the form that the Commissioner provides; and
pays to the Commissioner the renewal fee required by § 2-112 of this article.
An application for renewal of a license shall be considered made in a timely manner if it is postmarked on or before June 30 of the year of renewal.

section.section: The Commissioner shall renew the license of each holder who meets the requirements of this section.

If the holder of a license files an application for renewal before the license expires, the license shall remain in effect until:
the Commissioner issues a renewal license; or
5 days after the Commissioner refuses in writing to renew the license and serves notice of the refusal on the holder.
